meanings.definition: A person who supports or defends something.
meanings.sent1: The upholders of the law ensure justice is served.
meanings.sent2: The upholders of the team spirit always cheer loudly.
meanings.sent3: The upholders of good manners never forget to say please and thank you.
meanings.sent4: She was like an upholder of truth, always seeking honesty in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The upholders of democracy work tirelessly to protect people's rights.

meanings.definition: Those who maintain or uphold a particular belief or principle.
meanings.sent1: The upholders of tradition celebrate the same customs every year.
meanings.sent2: The upholders of honesty always tell the truth, no matter what.
meanings.sent3: The upholders of punctuality are never late, not even by a minute.
meanings.sent4: He stood tall like an upholder of justice, fighting for what is right.
meanings.sent5: The upholders of peace strive to create harmony in every situation.
